elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is the aim of the Price Disclosure Regulation?
elements.correctAnswer: Consumers should be able to easily compare the prices of goods and services and not be misled by confusing price information.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What price should be indicated?
elements.correctAnswer: For items displayed on the sales floor or in the shop window: Detailed price; for measurable goods: Base price; for measurable pre-packaged goods: Detailed price and basic price

elements.name: question2
rows: The Price Disclosure Ordinance (PBV) aims to achieve clear and comparable prices.
Thanks to the indication of the basic price, consumers can compare the prices of pre-packaged goods from different suppliers.
The detailed price is the detailed price per unit (e.g. per piece, per 100g, per unit).
It is the responsibility of the sales staff to announce the prices in accordance with the regulations.
Anyone who violates the Price Disclosure Ordinance will be fined or imprisoned.
A price indication with easily accessible and legible price lists or catalogs is permitted.
The actual price to be paid, the detailed price, can also be stated in euros or US dollars.
